title: Non-cost and Genuine! About the Authors

Steve has served as editor-contributor to three ASTD INFO-LINE publications and has contributed learning designs to the Team and Organization Development Sourcebook, The Pfeiffer Annual, Creative New Employee Orientation Programs, and The Active Manager’s Tool Kit
Steve’s past experience includes two military tours in Vietnam and stints as a training officer for the Bureau of Engraving and Printing and the Department of Health and Human Services
Steve has a master’s degree from the George Washington University and a bachelor of arts in economics from Bucknell University

container-title: To Improve the Academy (Professional and Organizational Development Network for Higher Education, 1994); Successful Negotiations: The Key to Privatization in Zambia (Ostrer & Associates
title: Carol has authored or coauthored numerous books and articles on academic ethics, the process of privatization in Africa, virtual collaboration, career development strategies, and the use of games to support workplace learning. Her published works include “Academic Ethics
Developing Virtual Teams
Readiness for Virtual Collaboration

container-title: Knowledge Management: Classic and Contemporary Works
title: Aligning Organizations for Virtual Teams
Shifting the Power Equation Through Knowledge Sharing
TeamSmart Tool for Team Development (MasteryWorks, 2001); and “Getting Ready for Virtuality

note: She is certified as a team facilitator, coach, and master trainer.
title: Carol has a master’s degree from American University and the National Training Laboratory in Organization Development, a master’s degree in international relations from Troy State University, and a bachelor of arts degree in international relations from American University
